DataGridViewCheckBoxCell Class

Definition

Displays a check box user interface (UI) to use in a DataGridView control.

In this Article

public class DataGridViewCheckBoxCell : System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell, System.Windows.Forms.IDataGridViewEditingCell

State

Remarks

The DataGridViewCheckBoxCell class is a specialized type of DataGridViewCell used to display binary or ternary information presented through a check box UI. In the default binary mode, the cells can hold values of true or false. In ternary mode, the cells take on one of the CheckState values. The ThreeState property determines whether binary or ternary mode is in effect.

The DataGridViewCheckBoxColumn is the column type specialized to hold cells of this type. By default, the CellTemplate is initialized to a new DataGridViewCheckBoxCell. To pattern the cells within a column after an existing DataGridViewCheckBoxCell, set the column's CellTemplate property to the cell to use as a pattern.

The cell-related properties of the column are wrappers for the similarly-named properties of the template cell. Changing the property values of the template cell will affect only cells based on the template that are added after the change. Changing the cell-related property values of the column, however, will update the template cell and all other cells in the column, and refresh the column display if necessary.

When the current cell is a DataGridViewCheckBoxCell, the IsCurrentCellInEditMode property is always true.

Typically, check box cell values are intended either for storage, like any other data, or for performing bulk operations. If you want to respond immediately when users click a check box cell, you can handle the System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellClick event, but this event occurs before the cell value is updated. If you need the new value at the time of the click, one option is to calculate what the expected value will be based on the current value. Another approach is to commit the change immediately, and handle the System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellValueChanged event to respond to it. To commit the change when the cell is clicked, you must handle the System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CurrentCellDirtyStateChanged event. In the handler, if the current cell is a check box cell, call the CommitEdit method and pass in the DataGridViewDataErrorContexts value.

Constructors

DataGridViewCheckBoxCell()

Initializes a new instance of the DataGridViewCheckBoxCell class to its default state.

public DataGridViewCheckBoxCell ();

Remarks

This constructor initializes the ThreeState property value to false.

DataGridViewCheckBoxCell(Boolean)

Initializes a new instance of the DataGridViewCheckBoxCell class, enabling binary or ternary state.

public DataGridViewCheckBoxCell (bool threeState);
threeState
Boolean

true to enable ternary state; false to enable binary state.

Remarks

The standard operation of a check box allows for two states: checked and unchecked. When the threeState parameter is set to true, an additional, indeterminate state is allowed, which is visually denoted by a grey partial check.

Properties

EditingCellFormattedValue

Gets or sets the formatted value of the control hosted by the cell when it is in edit mode.

public virtual object EditingCellFormattedValue { get; set; }
Value
Object

An Object representing the cell's value.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCheckBoxCell.FormattedValueType* property value is null.

-or-

The assigned value is null or is not of the type indicated by the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCheckBoxCell.FormattedValueType* property.

-or-

The assigned value is not of type Boolean nor of type CheckState.

InvalidOperationException

The stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCheckBoxCell.FormattedValueType* property value is null.

EditingCellValueChanged

Gets or sets a flag indicating that the value has been changed for this cell.

public virtual bool EditingCellValueChanged { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the cell's value has changed; otherwise, false.

Remarks

When a cell's value changes, it is marked as modified until that value is saved or the cell is reinitialized with data from its data source.

EditType

Gets the type of the cell's hosted editing control.

public override Type EditType { get; }
Value
Type

The Type of the underlying editing control.

Remarks

This overridden property always returns null because check boxes only allow selection and deselection, not editing.

FalseValue

Gets or sets the underlying value corresponding to a cell value of false.

public object FalseValue { get; set; }
Value
Object

An Object corresponding to a cell value of false. The default is null.

Remarks

The FalseValue, TrueValue, and IndeterminateValue properties determine the associated values of these states as they occur in the underlying data source.

Setting the FalseValue property of the owning column also sets the FalseValue property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

FlatStyle

Gets or sets the flat style appearance of the check box user interface (UI).

public System.Windows.Forms.FlatStyle FlatStyle { get; set; }
Value
FlatStyle

One of the FlatStyle values. The default is FlatStyle.

Exceptions
InvalidEnumArgumentException

The specified value when setting this property is not a valid FlatStyle value.

Remarks

The FlatStyle flat style is not supported by this cell type.

Setting the FlatStyle property of the owning column also sets the FlatStyle property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

FormattedValueType

Gets the type of the cell display value.

public override Type FormattedValueType { get; }
Value
Type

A Type representing the display type of the cell.

Remarks

If the ThreeState property value is false, the value of this property is the Boolean type; otherwise, it is the CheckState type.

IndeterminateValue

Gets or sets the underlying value corresponding to an indeterminate or null cell value.

public object IndeterminateValue { get; set; }
Value
Object

An Object corresponding to an indeterminate or null cell value. The default is null.

Remarks

The FalseValue, TrueValue, and IndeterminateValue properties determine the associated values of these states as they occur in the underlying data source.

Setting the IndeterminateValue property of the owning column also sets the IndeterminateValue property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

ThreeState

Gets or sets a value indicating whether ternary mode has been enabled for the hosted check box control.

public bool ThreeState { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if ternary mode is enabled; false if binary mode is enabled. The default is false.

Remarks

The third state in ternary mode typically represents an uninitialized or indeterminate value.

Setting the ThreeState property of the owning column also sets the ThreeState property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

Unlike the column ThreeState property, the cell ThreeState property does not automatically update the NullValue property of the associated cell style when you change its value. When you change the cell ThreeState property value to true, be sure to set the NullValue property of the object returned by the Style property to CheckState. When you change the ThreeState property value to false, be sure to set the NullValue property to false.

TrueValue

Gets or sets the underlying value corresponding to a cell value of true.

public object TrueValue { get; set; }
Value
Object

An Object corresponding to a cell value of true. The default is null.

Remarks

The FalseValue, TrueValue, and IndeterminateValue properties determine the associated values of these states as they occur in the underlying data source.

Setting the TrueValue property of the owning column also sets the TrueValue property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

ValueType

Gets the data type of the values in the cell.

public override Type ValueType { get; set; }
Value
Type

The Type of the underlying value of the cell.

Remarks

If the ValueType property of the cell has not been set, then the ValueType property for the owning DataGridViewCheckBoxColumn is used, if the column exists.

If no owning column exists, then this property is set to the default type appropriate for its mode: Boolean for binary mode and CheckState for ternary mode.

The Value is the actual data object contained in the cell, whereas the FormattedValue property is the formatted representation of this object. The ValueType and FormattedValueType properties correspond to the data types of these values, respectively.

ContentClickUnsharesRow(DataGridViewCellEventArgs)

Indicates whether the row containing the cell will be unshared when the cell content is clicked.

protected override bool ContentClickUnsharesRow (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellEventArgs e);
e
DataGridViewCellEventArgs

A DataGridViewCellEventArgs that contains data about the mouse click.

Returns
Boolean

true if the cell is in edit mode; otherwise, false.

Remarks

ContentClickUnsharesRow is called just before OnContentClick. It must return true if the call to OnContentClick has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell. It should return false otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

Indicates whether the row containing the cell will be unshared when the cell content is double-clicked.

protected override bool ContentDoubleClickUnsharesRow (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellEventArgs e);
e
DataGridViewCellEventArgs

A DataGridViewCellEventArgs that contains data about the double-click.

Returns
Boolean

true if the cell is in edit mode; otherwise, false.

Remarks

ContentDoubleClickUnsharesRow is called just before OnContentDoubleClick. It must return true if the call to OnContentDoubleClick has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell. It should return false otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

Creates a new accessible object for the DataGridViewCheckBoxCell.

Returns

A new DataGridViewCheckBoxCell.DataGridViewCheckBoxCellAccessibleObject for the DataGridViewCheckBoxCell.

Remarks

If you do not explicitly call the CreateAccessibilityInstance method, it will be called when the AccessibilityObject property is referenced.

Note

To get or set AccessibilityObject, you must add a reference to the Accessibility assembly installed with the .NET Framework.

Returns the bounding rectangle that encloses the cell's content area, which is calculated using the specified Graphics and cell style.

Graphics

cellStyle

rowIndex

Returns

GetEditingCellFormattedValue(DataGridViewDataErrorContexts)

Gets the formatted value of the cell while it is in edit mode.

public virtual object GetEditingCellFormattedValue (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts context);
context
DataGridViewDataErrorContexts

A bitwise combination of DataGridViewDataErrorContexts values that describes the context in which any formatting error occurs.

Returns
Object

An Object representing the formatted value of the editing cell.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCheckBoxCell.FormattedValueType* property value is null.

Remarks

When context includes the DataGridViewDataErrorContexts value, this method returns an Object that you can cast to a String representation of the value. Otherwise, this method returns a Boolean or a CheckState value, depending on the value of the FormattedValueType property.

Returns the bounding rectangle that encloses the cell's error icon, if one is displayed.

graphics

The graphics context for the cell.

cellStyle

rowIndex

Returns

GetFormattedValue(Object,Int32,DataGridViewCellStyle,TypeConverter,TypeConverter,DataGridViewDataErrorContexts)

Gets the formatted value of the cell's data.

protected override object GetFormattedValue (object value, int rowIndex, ref System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle cellStyle, System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter valueTypeConverter, System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter formattedValueTypeConverter, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts context);
value
Object

The value to be formatted.

rowIndex
Int32

The index of the cell's parent row.

cellStyle
DataGridViewCellStyle

The DataGridViewCellStyle in effect for the cell.

valueTypeConverter
TypeConverter

A TypeConverter associated with the value type that provides custom conversion to the formatted value type, or null if no such custom conversion is needed.

formattedValueTypeConverter
TypeConverter

A TypeConverter associated with the formatted value type that provides custom conversion from the value type, or null if no such custom conversion is needed.

context
DataGridViewDataErrorContexts

A bitwise combination of DataGridViewDataErrorContexts values describing the context in which the formatted value is needed.

Returns
Object

The value of the cell's data after formatting has been applied or null if the cell is not part of a DataGridView control.

Remarks

The DataGridView control calls this method to convert a cell value into an equivalent display value of the type indicated by the FormattedValueType property. The control passes the cell value to this method in the value parameter.

This method first attempts to convert value to a Boolean or CheckState value using the TrueValue, FalseValue, and IndeterminateValue properties if they have been set.

If the conversion is unsuccessful, the System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataError event occurs. If there is no handler for this event or the handler sets the ThrowException property to true, an exception is thrown.

If the conversion is successful or there is a handler for the DataError event and it does not set the ThrowException property to true, the System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellFormatting event occurs.

A CellFormatting event handler can modify both value and cellStyle. If the handler does not set the FormattingApplied property to true, however, this method formats value using the formatting properties of the cellStyle object. This can result in an additional DataError event.

If formatting is successful and the context parameter value includes the DataGridViewDataErrorContexts value, this method returns the String version of the formatted value for copying to the Clipboard. Otherwise, this method returns the formatted value for display in the DataGridView control.

constraintSize

KeyDownUnsharesRow(KeyEventArgs,Int32)

Indicates whether the row containing the cell is unshared when a key is pressed while the cell has focus.

protected override bool KeyDownUnsharesRow (System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs e, int rowIndex);
e
KeyEventArgs

A KeyEventArgs that contains data about the key press.

rowIndex
Int32

The index of the row containing the cell.

Returns
Boolean

true if the SPACE key is pressed and the CTRL, ALT, and SHIFT keys are all not pressed; otherwise, false.

Remarks

KeyDownUnsharesRow is called just before OnKeyDown. It must return true if the call to OnKeyDown with the same KeyEventArgs argument has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell. It should return false otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

e
KeyEventArgs

A KeyEventArgs that contains data about the key press.

rowIndex
Int32

The index of the row containing the cell.

Returns
Boolean

true if the SPACE key is released; otherwise, false.

Remarks

KeyUpUnsharesRow is called just before OnKeyUp. It must return true if the call to OnKeyUp with the same KeyEventArgs argument has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell. It should return false otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

MouseDownUnsharesRow(DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs)

Indicates whether the row containing the cell will be unshared when the mouse button is pressed while the pointer is over the cell.

e
DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs

A DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs that contains data about the mouse click.

Returns
Boolean

Always true.

Remarks

Pressing the mouse button always unshares a row containing a cell of this type.

MouseDownUnsharesRow is called just before OnMouseDown. It must return true if the call to OnMouseDown has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell. It should return false otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

Int32

The index of the row containing the cell.

Returns

true if the cell was the last cell receiving a mouse click; otherwise, false.

Remarks

MouseUpUnsharesRow is called just before OnMouseEnter. It must return true if the call to OnMouseEnter has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell. It should return false otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

The index of the row containing the cell.

MouseLeaveUnsharesRow is called just before OnMouseLeave. It must return true if the call to OnMouseLeave has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell. It should return false otherwise.

Indicates whether the row containing the cell will be unshared when the mouse button is released while the pointer is over the cell.

e
DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs

A DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs that contains data about the mouse click.

Returns
Boolean

Always true.

Remarks

For this cell type, releasing the mouse while the pointer is over the cell always unshares the row containing the cell.

MouseUpUnsharesRow is called just before OnMouseUp. It must return true if the call to OnMouseUp has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell. It should return false otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

Called when the cell's contents are clicked.

OnKeyDown(KeyEventArgs,Int32)

Called when a character key is pressed while the focus is on a cell.

protected override void OnKeyDown (System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs e, int rowIndex);
e
KeyEventArgs

A KeyEventArgs that contains the event data

rowIndex
Int32

The row index of the current cell, or -1 if the cell is not owned by a row.

Remarks

When activated by the space key, this method causes the cell's user interface (UI) to be updated.

This method is similar to the OnKeyDown method. It is called in the same circumstances in which a System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyDown event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.

OnKeyUp(KeyEventArgs,Int32)

Called when a character key is released while the focus is on a cell.

protected override void OnKeyUp (System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs e, int rowIndex);
e
KeyEventArgs

A KeyEventArgs that contains the event data

rowIndex
Int32

The row index of the current cell, or -1 if the cell is not owned by a row.

Remarks

When activated by the SPACEBAR key (equivalent to the System.Windows.Forms.Keys value), this method updates the cell's user interface (UI) and raises the OnCellClick event on the owning DataGridView.

This method is similar to the OnKeyUp method. It is called in the same circumstances in which a System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyUp event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.

OnLeave(Int32,Boolean)

Called when the focus moves from a cell.

protected override void OnLeave (int rowIndex, bool throughMouseClick);

Int32

The row index of the current cell, or -1 if the cell is not owned by a row.

throughMouseClick
Boolean

true if the cell was left as a result of user mouse click rather than a programmatic cell change; otherwise, false.

Remarks

If the button is in a pushed state, this method updates the cell's user interface (UI).

This method is similar to the OnLeave method. It is called in the same circumstances in which a System.Windows.Forms.Control.Leave event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.

Paint(Graphics,Rectangle,Rectangle,Int32,DataGridViewElementStates,Object,Object,String,DataGridViewCellStyle,DataGridViewAdvancedBorderStyle,DataGridViewPaintParts)

Paints the current DataGridViewCheckBoxCell.

protected override void Paint (System.Drawing.Graphics graphics, System.Drawing.Rectangle clipBounds, System.Drawing.Rectangle cellBounds, int rowIndex, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates elementState, object value, object formattedValue, string errorText, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle cellStyle, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewAdvancedBorderStyle advancedBorderStyle, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewPaintParts paintParts);

Graphics

The Graphics used to paint the cell.

clipBounds
Rectangle

A Rectangle that represents the area of the DataGridView that needs to be repainted.

cellBounds
Rectangle

A Rectangle that contains the bounds of the cell that is being painted.

rowIndex
Int32

The row index of the cell that is being painted.

elementState
DataGridViewElementStates

A bitwise combination of DataGridViewElementStates values that specifies the state of the cell.

value
Object

The data of the cell that is being painted.

formattedValue
Object

The formatted data of the cell that is being painted.

errorText

An error message that is associated with the cell.

cellStyle

A DataGridViewCellStyle that contains formatting and style information about the cell.

advancedBorderStyle

A DataGridViewAdvancedBorderStyle that contains border styles for the cell that is being painted.

paintParts

A bitwise combination of the DataGridViewPaintParts values that specifies which parts of the cell need to be painted.

ParseFormattedValue(Object,DataGridViewCellStyle,TypeConverter,TypeConverter)

Converts a value formatted for display to an actual cell value.

public override object ParseFormattedValue (object formattedValue, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle cellStyle, System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter formattedValueTypeConverter, System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter valueTypeConverter);
formattedValue
Object

The display value of the cell.

cellStyle
DataGridViewCellStyle

The DataGridViewCellStyle in effect for the cell.

formattedValueTypeConverter
TypeConverter

A TypeConverter for the display value type, or null to use the default converter.

valueTypeConverter
TypeConverter

A TypeConverter for the cell value type, or null to use the default converter.

Returns
Object

The cell value.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

cellStyle is null.

FormatException

The stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValueType* property value is null.

ArgumentException

formattedValue is null.

- or -

The type of formattedValue does not match the type indicated by the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValueType* property.

Remarks

When the user edits a cell value and commits the change, the DataGridView control calls this method to convert the displayed value from the FormattedValueType to the ValueType. The control then sets the underlying cell value or data source value to the converted value.

This method converts the display value of the cell to an actual cell value using the values of the TrueValue, FalseValue, and IndeterminateValue properties if they have been set.

PrepareEditingCellForEdit(Boolean)

This method is not meaningful for this type.

public virtual void PrepareEditingCellForEdit (bool selectAll);
selectAll
Boolean

This parameter is ignored.

Remarks

No preparation is necessary for this cell type.

ToString()

Returns the string representation of the cell.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

A String that represents the current cell.

Remarks

The string representation of the cell includes the row index and column index of the cell.
